Uzbek and Chinese Leaders Discuss Further Expanding Multifaceted and Comprehensive Strategic Partnership
24.01.2024
As part of the agenda of the state visit, the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev and the President of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China Xi Jinping held talks in Beijing on January 24 with the participation of members of official delegations.
At the outset of the meeting, the President of our country expressed his sincere gratitude to the Chinese Leader for the invitation and warm welcome, as well as high assessment of the reforms in New Uzbekistan.
The Leaders noted a significant breakthrough in bilateral relations in recent years.
The increasing dynamics of contacts at all levels, strengthening of political dialogue, and mutual support on key issues were noted with particular satisfaction.
The first Foreign Ministersâ€™ Strategic Dialogue was held in Beijing last November. Inter-parliamentary cooperation has intensified.
Our President thanked the Chinese Leader for his personal attention and support for cooperation on poverty reduction.
The two sides welcomeed the launch of a pilot project to introduce the Chinese system of vocational education in Uzbekistan â€“ â€œLuban Workshopâ€.
Trade, economic, and investment cooperation is dynamically developing.
Last yearâ€™s trade turnover reached $14 billion. Both sides share the opinion that there are all possibilities to increase the trade turnover to $20 billion in the near future.
In recent years, the volume of Chinese investment in the Uzbek economy has increased fivefold and the number of joint ventures has tripled.
An agreement on preparation and adoption of cooperation programs in infrastructure development, industrial cooperation, technology transfer in agriculture and green energy was reached.
In this context, the sides noted with satisfaction the commissioning of two new 1000 megawatt solar power plants in Uzbekistan at the end of last year with the participation of Chinese companies.
The current level of fruitful financial and technical cooperation with leading Chinese banks and the Silk Road Fund, as well as the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank was highly assessed.
The Head of our state welcomed the agreements on the expansion of financial instruments to support investment projects, including the creation of a joint platform, as well as the decision of the Export-Import Bank of China to open a regional office for Central Asia in the city of Tashkent.
The President also encouraged Chinese partners to actively participate in the privatization processes of state-owned enterprises and banks in Uzbekistan.
The Leaders welcomed the intensification of interregional exchanges. They agreed to establish the Council of Regions of Uzbekistan and China to coordinate cooperation in this direction.
The importance of the early start of practical work on the construction of the China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railway, which is expected to become an important component of the Transcontinental Transport and Transit Bridge under the â€œOne Belt, One Roadâ€ initiative, was emphasized.
The success of the first education forum in Beijing and the exhibition of Uzbekistanâ€™s tourism prospects in Shanghai held on the eve of the event was noted. Residents and guests of the Chinese capital showed great interest in the events held as part of the Days of Uzbek Culture.
The sides pointed out the need to intensify cooperation in education and tourism, and continue the practice of holding mutual cultural days. A proposal was made to hold the first joint Youth Innovation Forum.
For the practical implementation of all planned activities and initiatives, the parties agreed to hold meetings of the Intergovernmental Committee and all subcommittees in the first half of this year.
The parties also exchanged views on topical issues of the regional agenda and international politics.
The unwavering position in support of the â€œOne Chinaâ€ policy and the fight against the â€œthree evil forcesâ€ was reaffirmed.
In conclusion, the Uzbek Leader invited the Chinese President to pay a visit to our country and congratulated the friendly people of China on the upcoming Chinese New Year - Chun Jie holiday.
The meeting was held in a traditionally trusting, open, and friendly atmosphere.
President
of the Republic of Uzbekistan

### 64

TITLE: President of Uzbekistan Calls for International Unity in 'Green' Silk Road

President
of the Republic of Uzbekistan

President of Uzbekistan Calls for International Unity in 'Green' Silk Road
18.10.2023
President of the Republic of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev attended the opening ceremony of the Third Belt and Road International Forum and its plenary session on the topic of "Joint Construction of the 'Green' Silk Road for the Harmonious Coexistence of Humanity and Nature" on October 18 in Beijing.
The Summit, moderated by Vice President of the People's Republic of China Han Zheng, was also attended by the Secretary-General of the United Nations AntÃ³nio Guterres, heads of state and government and leaders of financial institutions.
In his speech, the Head of our state sincerely congratulated all the participants of the event on the tenth anniversary of the "Belt and Road" Initiative.
It is noted that over a short period, this grand idea of reviving the Great Silk Road has gained numerous supporters, becoming a new model of international cooperation. Uzbekistan, as a comprehensive strategic partner of China, was among the first to support the "Belt and Road" Initiative. Uzbekistan has expressed a firm commitment to further advancing its main goals and objectives.
The President of our country emphasized that the "Green" Silk Road Initiative essentially shapes the agenda for a common "green" future. Uzbekistan fully supports this initiative, which was first proposed by Chinese President Xi Jinping in our country in 2016.
Pointing out the complex ecological situation in the region, manifested by abnormal weather conditions, droughts, dust storms, land degradation, desertification, and loss of biodiversity, the Head of our state stated that Central Asia is becoming one of the most vulnerable regions to the consequences of climate change.
It is noted that Uzbekistan is implementing a comprehensive program to establish an Ecological Innovation and Technology Zone in the Aral Sea region within the framework of the adopted special resolution of the United Nations General Assembly.
In this context, a high assessment is given to the outcomes of the Climate Change Summit held in September of this year, initiated by the United Nations Secretary-General. The Summit addressed ambitious climate-related tasks.
To facilitate the exchange of views and unite efforts in achieving the goals of "green" development in Central Asia, the President of Uzbekistan has put forward the initiative to hold the Samarkand International Climate Forum in 2024.
"We hope that this Forum will be a practical step towards creating the 'Samarkand Dialogue for the Sake of the Future' to find answers to the global threats of sustainable development," stated the President of our country.
There is an expressed interest in developing broad international cooperation within the framework of the "Green" Silk Road. In this regard, the Leader of Uzbekistan shared his vision for further deepening partnerships with China and other participants of the "Belt and Road" Initiative.
As part of the alignment of conceptual initiatives -- the "Green Agenda of Central Asia" and the "Green Silk Road", it has been proposed to develop a comprehensive "green" development program. This program would include measures and projects for the "green" transformation and digitalization of economic sectors, the creation of sustainable infrastructure in the transportation and energy sectors, the establishment of "green" industrial capacities, poverty reduction, and the development of smart agriculture.
Another important task in the construction of the "Green" Silk Road is the development of "green" production chains and innovations. There is a readiness expressed to create a Special Demonstration Technopark in the Aral Sea region jointly with leading Chinese companies and other international partners. This Techno Park aims to promote industrial and socially significant programs based on the widespread adoption of "green" technologies.
The Head of our state has proposed the establishment of the "Green Financing Fund" in Uzbekistan to support the development of a low-carbon economy and "clean" technologies, as well as the implementation of high environmental standards in the region.
The Leader of Uzbekistan has also called for the reduction of restrictions and barriers in mutual trade of "green" goods, especially agricultural products. Additionally, it has been proposed to intensify the dialogue on transitioning to "green" energy and to hold regular meetings of ministers from the countries participating in the "Belt and Road" initiative.
The President of Uzbekistan has put forward the initiative to create a scientific and information platform for the transfer of "green" knowledge and solutions based on the International Innovation Center of the Aral Sea region.
Given the growing shortage of skilled professionals in the field of "green" development and ecology, the Leader of our country has advocated for the development of a Program for Training Specialists and the enhancement of academic exchanges in the field of "green" development and ecology. This program would be based at the Central Asian University for Environmental Studies and Climate Change, in collaboration with leading foreign universities and educational centers.
Furthermore, the Head of our state emphasized the importance of responsible stewardship of natural resources and the environment. It has been proposed to launch a Global Program for the Development of "Green" Culture within the "Belt and Road" initiative. This program would involve organizing ethno-ecological festivals, forums, presentations, and other events featuring prominent public figures, scientists, business leaders, and cultural representatives.
In conclusion, President Shavkat Mirziyoyev expressed confidence that the fruitful results of the Forum would make a significant contribution to the collective effort of building a "green" future for humanity.
President
of the Republic of Uzbekistan
When using materials reference to www.president.uz is required

### 65
URL: https://president.uz/en/lists/view/7791
TITLE: Address by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev to the participants of the ceremony dedicated to the launch of the China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railroad construction project

President
of the Republic of Uzbekistan

Address by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev to the participants of the ceremony dedicated to the launch of the China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railroad construction project
27.12.2024
Distinguished participants of the event!
I sincerely welcome you at the inauguration ceremony of construction of the new China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railway.
The first-ever full-fledged Agreement on the implementation of this strategic trans-regional project was signed six months ago. The preparation of technical documentation has been completed in a short span of time. And today, we are launching relevant construction works.
This is a truly historic event, which marks the 30 years-long journey of our friendly countries.
A new transportation artery of international significance is being formed.
It will connect the Central Asian region with China through the shortest overland route and further expand multifaceted cooperation and strengthen the strategic partnership among our countries.
The project is also perfectly aligned with the goals of the Belt and Road Initiative, today uniting many countries of the world for the benefit of common sustainable development and prosperity.
In this regard, I would like to once again express my gratitude to my esteemed colleagues â€“ Mr. Xi Jinping, the President of the People's Republic of China, and Mr. Sadyr Japarov, the President of the Kyrgyz Republic, for their personal contribution and active efforts in promoting the project.
Dear participants of the ceremony!
I would like to underscore the great impact that the construction of the new railway will have on the economies of our countries and our vast region.
This major infrastructure project envisages extensive cooperation with cutting-edge engineering, innovative and digital solutions, while complying with high environmental standards.
A total of 20 stations, 42 bridges and 25 tunnels will be built along the Kashgar - Torugart - Makmal - Jalal-Abad - Andijan route.
In addition, state-of-the-art transit and logistics infrastructure, as well as warehouses and terminals will be developed.
It is estimated that the commissioning of this road will have a multiplier effect on regional trade and investment, significantly reduce transport costs and unlock the enormous transit potential of Central Asia.
I would like to point out a few more figures.
The annual freight traffic along the corridor will total 15 million tons.
The distance and delivery time of goods from China to European markets will reduce by several thousand kilometers and almost a week.
There will be an opportunity to organize regular passenger traffic services.
In the long run, interlinking of this railway with the Trans-Afghan corridor will effectively connect and strengthen the transport and communication interconnectivity of China, Central and South Asia.
Obviously, all our countries will feel the economic benefits. Hundreds of new enterprises and tens of thousands of jobs will be created.
And, certainly, this project will facilitate the revival of the Great Silk Road, the development of cultural and humanitarian exchanges, and further bringing of our peoples closer together.
Dear friends!
Uzbekistan is committed to activeÂ participation in all stages of the construction of the railway, making full use of all available technical and intellectual resources.
I am convinced that with joint efforts this transport corridor will become another symbol of our strong friendship, partnership and progress.
On the eve of the New Year, I wish every success to the engineers, construction workers, and all those involved in the implementation of this strategic project. Today your hands are building the shared future of our countries and our region.
Thank you for your attention.
President
of the Republic of Uzbekistan
When using materials reference to www.president.uz is required

### 67
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/news/summit-of-china-and-17-countries-of-central-and-eastern-europe
TITLE: Summit of China and 17 countries of Central and Eastern Europe
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

News
09.02.2021. - 15:22
Summit of China and 17 countries of Central and Eastern Europe
At the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping, the President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ participated today in the video-conference Summit of China and 17 countries of Central and Eastern Europe.
"Distinguished Excellency, President of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China, Mr. Xi Jinping,
Your Excellencies, representatives of the Central and Eastern European Countries,
Dear Friends,
Exactly two weeks ago, when he was addressing the World Economic Forum, President Xi underlined that â€œdivided world cannot fight common challenges the mankind is facing. Multilateralism is about having international affairs addressed through consultation and the future of the world decided by everyone working together. We must stick to the cooperation concept based on mutual benefit, to safeguard equal rights of development for all countries and to promote competition based on righteousness and justice. Â And scientific and technological advances should benefit all humanity rather than be used to curb and contain other countries' development.
On behalf of the citizens of the Republic of Serbia and on my personal behalf, I want to thank our host for his warm welcoming words and for the privilege to address this distinguished gathering.
Honorable President Xi,
I was deeply moved by your invitation. It was on time that you had recognized the need to initiate this forum, and today you insist on a true need for â€œChina and CEEC to intensify communication, to reach consensus and pave the way for future cooperation supporting economic and social recovery and development in post-COVID era.â€
I agree with your conclusion that through cooperation mechanisms offered through this format of the dialogue â€œwe will contribute, to great extent, to enrichment of overall cooperation between China and Europe.â€
The importance that the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China attaches to this gathering is best reflected in a fact that our host will be a person of big international reputation and the architect of multilateralism- President Xi.
Serbia had to respond reciprocally to such a gesture of respect, and that is why President of the Republic is addressing.
I am very pleased that trade exchange between China and Central and Eastern European Countries increased by 8,4% in 2020, going thus beyond 100 billion dollars.
In overall trade exchange between Serbia and the world in 2020, China was at the third place. In 2020, trade exchange was close to 3.7 billion USD which is 30% growth comparing to 2018. Only in the past 5 years, our export to China increased 15 times.
In 2020 there was a historic maximum of our export to China, and just for the comparison sake, our export to China in 2010 was only 7.3 million, and this year â€“ more than 377 million USD.
By the end of 2020, Chinese direct investment in the Central and Eastern European Countries including energy, infrastructure and logistics were 3.14 billion dollars gross, while investment of the respective countries in China reached 1.72 billion dollars.
I take the liberty of saying that this is about establishing new development paradigm and making global cooperation in fighting coronavirus pandemic easier.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Allow me to briefly inform you on the current economic parameters in the Republic of Serbia, which are the result of implementation of economic measures aimed at mitigating COVID-19 pandemic consequences.
Today, after difficult reforms and despite the pandemic, Serbia notes unprecedented results in its modern history. We are the first in Europe judging by growth rate, and second in terms of number of vaccinated people.
We want to preserve good results and keep improving Serbia.
Immunization in Serbia has started by the vaccine manufactured by the Chinese company Sinopharm, together with the American Pfizer and Russian Sputnik V vaccines. We also expect vaccine deliveries through COVAX and the European Union.
Serbia managed to become a positive example in the entire Europe, thanks to unselfish and fraternal help of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China and President Xi.
Since life cannot and must not stop, I would like to remind you that Serbia hosted the
Fourth
China-CEEC Ministerial
Conference on Innovation
, whose biggest result was Belgrade Declaration on Cooperation in the Field of Innovation.
Serbia wants to strengthen its position in the region when it comes to development of innovation, intelligence, robotics and digitalization, which we see as a path for creating better, more prosperous and more satisfied society.
Possibility of having our country as a host for the center of the smart cities is of strategic interest for Serbia.
Belt and Road, this magnificent vision of the President Xi is getting clear shape right in front of our eyes. Serbia is on its EU path and at the same time will do its best to strengthen ties with our Chinese friends.
Donated and purchased medical equipment shipped from China reached Serbia through ancient routes of the Silk Road, from Xiâ€™an and Wuhan, through Hungary to Serbia.
Unlike the ancient Silk Road, medication and equipment came to the Balkans with more than 88 flights, and using numerous railway compositions.
Modernization of Belgrade-Budapest railroad will enable even faster transportation of goods towards Greek ports, and better connectivity between China and numerous Asian countries with Europe.
We believe that continuous dialogue on the highest political level is crucial for development of strategic relations between Serbia and China in all areas of economic, culture and medical activities.
I hope that as soon as the epidemiological situation in Serbia enables that, we will have the opportunity to welcome President Xi Jinping again.
I am pleased to conclude that there was almost no impact of the pandemic on working processes, and that numerous Chinese companies in Serbia continued working on realization of the agreed projects, like construction works on highways on Corridors X and XI, as well as on numerous projects in the field of energy.
In the end of January this year, the Memorandum of Understanding for the â€œBelgrade Metroâ€ project between the Government of the Republic of Serbia, the City of Belgrade and Chinese company â€œPower Chinaâ€ and French company â€œAlstomâ€Â  that is supposed to start in the third quarter of 2021 was signed.
We expect that cooperation will intensify in the field of sports, agriculture, education, science and technology, where Serbia-China Industrial Park Project in Belgrade is of big importance.
Additionally, Serbia successfully presented its achievements on the Third China International Import Expo in Shanghai in November 2020.
Previous year has displayed all weaknesses of the mankind and forced each country to reexamine its capacities, putting at the same time to serious test many new alliances, but also traditional ties.
Basic postulates we had built on our habits on free flow of people, goods, capital and services were shaken by global introduction of quarantine and actual limitation of the freedom of movement.
Distinguished President Xi, allow me to avail myself of this opportunity to renew to you, on behalf of the citizens of the Republic of Serbia and on my personal behalf, our deepest gratitude for prompt assistance in medical equipment that the Government of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China made available to my country and my people, and to â€œFire Eyeâ€ laboratories that China donated to Serbia were of great significance in virus detection.
Only through cooperation between all countries, exchange of experience in the spirit of solidarity and understanding, but also through openness and identifying new cooperation modalities, a global recovery will be possible.
Dear Friends,
According to the traditional Chinese lunar calendar, New Year begins in three days. The year ahead will be in the sign of Buffalo. According to the ancient belief, the Year of Buffalo is a year when many of us will reach new knowledge and decisions. More importantly, the upcoming period will be good for all those who are used to hard work.
Finally, I would like to remind you of a far-reaching speech of the President Xi, as of May 15th 2017. On that occasion, my friend draws accurate parallels between the Silk Road and â€œBelt and Roadâ€ Initiative. The development of the Belt and Road is rooted in history, but orients to the future. The ancient Silk Road embodied the pursuit of a better life of our ancestors, promoted the interconnection of countries in Asia and Europe, pushed forward the exchanges and mutual learning of civilizations between the East and the West, and made great contributions to the development and progress of human civilization. We can fully draw wisdom and strength from the ancient Silk Road, promote cooperation in the spirit of peaceful cooperation, openness and tolerance, mutual learning, mutual benefit and win-win, and open up a brighter future together.
Long live friendship between Serbia and China!",Â said President VuÄiÄ‡ in his address.
Belgrade,9th February 2021

### 68
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/news/president-vucic-attends-the-arrival-of-the-first-cargo-train-from-china-to-serbia
TITLE: President VuÄiÄ‡ attends the arrival of the first cargo train from China to Serbia
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

News
24.10.2019. - 16:21
President VuÄiÄ‡ attends the arrival of the first cargo train from China to Serbia
President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ and Vice Minister of Trade of the People's Republic of China Qian Keming attended today the arrival of the first cargo train from China to Serbia. The cargo train of the Chinese company "China Railway Express", with over 500 tons of equipment for the construction of the fast railway through Serbia, arrived at the New Belgrade railway station.
Photo: TANJUG / Rade PreliÄ‡
President VuÄiÄ‡ said that it will take 30 minutes by train from Belgrade to Novi Sad if the works are completed within the stipulated deadline.
He added that the fast railway to Subotica will be finished by 2022 and that he will talk to the Prime Minister of Hungary Viktor OrbÃ¡n so that the works get expedited on their side as well.
President VuÄiÄ‡ emphasised that it will take merely 2.4 hours to get from Belgrade to Budapest which implies that it will take four and a half hours to Vienna which is far better than to commute by plane considering the time spent at the airports.
â€That will be a perfect connection with Europe", said President VuÄiÄ‡ and added that Serbia is not a stop-by station for the Chinese trains anymore, but rather a destination.
"These are the important days for us because for nearly 40 years almost nobody was using trains in passenger and cargo transportation. I think we will manage to return railway transportation through a wide gate back to our country. I am grateful to our Chinese friends for working with great attention to this project through which we confirm that we can change ourselves. Please, convey the most sincere greetings of the people of Serbia to the President of the People's Republic of China Xi Jinping. Long live the steel friendship of Serbia and China", said President VuÄiÄ‡.
Photo: TANJUG / Rade PreliÄ‡
President VuÄiÄ‡ added that the Chinese train departed from China on the 24th September and that it traversed the 10.500 kilometres long way bringing the state-of-the-art equipment for the fast railway in Serbia which meets and exceeds all the European standards and holds all the certificates for the fast railways.
He thanked the Chinese railways for connecting Belgrade and Budapest by a fast railway because thus we will be well connected to Central and Western Europe.
"In this way, we also show what it is that we can do", said President VuÄiÄ‡ and added that Belgrade is now the city of construction cranes and that the capital, as well as the entire country, keeps developing rapidly.
President VuÄiÄ‡ also said that back in 1837 Duke MiloÅ¡ suggested the construction of a railway through Serbia towards Austria-Hungary, but that even then Serbs had the unbelievable talent to resist any progress. Thus the first 12 kilometres long narrow-gauge railway was constructed by a foreigner in 1880 who was the manager of the Majdanpek mine and only some time later the first railway Belgrade-NiÅ¡ was commissioned in 1884.
He also said that in 2011 the train from Belgrade to Novi Sad was slower than 100 years ago, which shows how large were the unconcern and negligence of the state at that time.
Photo: TANJUG / Rade PreliÄ‡
"My idea was to criss-cross and cover Serbia with all the modern communications, roads, railways, internet, and that thus Serbia joins in the developed economies with solved infrastructural issues", emphasised President VuÄiÄ‡.
President VuÄiÄ‡ iterated and underlined that Serbia would not be able to do all that without the help of the President of China Xi Jinping who is the great friend of our country and for which reason the Chinese companies engage in construction works across all parts of Serbia. The President asked the Vice Minister of Trade Qian Keming to convey to President Xi the most sincere greetings from him and from the Serbian people and added that he always speaks sincerely about China within the domains of the world politics.
The Chinese Vice Minister of Trade Qian Keming said that Serbia and China foster the steel friendship and that they jointly face all the challenges, and that today's arrival of the cargo train of the company "China Railway Express" serves as evidence of the long history of friendship that connects the two countries.
"Our two countries rely on each other, they are friends of steel who advance together through all challenges. Serbia is the first country in the Central and Eastern Europe to establish the overall and comprehensive strategic partnership relations with China", said Keming.
Photo: TANJUG / Rade PreliÄ‡
He emphasised that the agreements and joint efforts of President VuÄiÄ‡ and President Xi prompt the building up of the "Belt and Road" initiative thus giving momentum to the deeper development of cooperation between China and the countries of Central and Eastern Europe.
"Bilateral trade rapidly increases, results are being achieved in all areas and especially in the area of infrastructure", said Keming.
The Vice Minister of Trade of the People's Republic of China Kemin reminded that at the Second high-level summit within the "Belt and Road" initiative, President Xi said that high quality "Belt and Road" should be jointly built where the accent should be placed on the mutual connection and improvement of infrastructure connections.
"The Belgrade-Budapest railway will be realised within the 'Belt and Road' initiative. This is the first project in the area of railway transportation to be implemented by a Chinese company in Europe. It is very important for regional infrastructural inter-connection", said Keming.
He explained that "China Railway Express" connects all the countries along the Road which at the same time represents the "bridge of friendship" that unites the people of China with the people of all the countries included in the "Belt and Road" initiative.
"This train departed a month ago from the homeland of Confucius - the Shandong province - and today it arrived in Belgrade loaded with the material and equipment for the Belgrade-Budapest railroad. This is a signal to accelerate the section on the Serbian side", said Keming.
The Vice Minister of Trade of the People's Republic of China Qian Keming wished a successful construction of the railway, even better cooperation between China and Serbia in the area of trade, and ended his address with the message: "Long live the friendship of China and Serbia!".

### 69
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/press-releases/letter-of-congratulations-to-the-president-of-the-peoples-republic-of-china-28320
TITLE: Letter of congratulations to the President of the People's Republic of China
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

Press Releases
01.10.2019. - 07:06
Letter of congratulations to the President of the People's Republic of China
President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ extended his congratulations to the President of the People's Republic of China Xi Jinping on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, accompanied by the best wishes to the Chinese people with whom we are tied by a steel friendship, to continue with the overall progress following the wise leadership. The congratulation reads as follows:
"Serbia welcomes all the accomplishments that China has achieved since its founding on October 1, 1949. Under the visionary leadership of its leaders, with the strong unity of the Communist Party of China and in spite of the numerous challenges on the internal and international levels, your stunning country has grown into one of the world's most valued partners in the last seven decades, contributing to peace and stability as well as to global development.
Allow me, Excellency, to express my deep admiration for you and other great Chinese leaders, as all the successes of China over the last seven decades have been the result of yours and their thoughtfulness, knowledge, courage and firm belief in the people and their ideals. With its unparalleled development in just 70 years, China has shown to the world how the tenacity, work and commitment of leadership and people can create an economic power from an underdeveloped country, a pioneer in infrastructure endeavours and a leader in the field of innovations, modern technology and space exploration. At the same time, China is one of the best examples of how to defend integrity and state sovereignty in a peaceful and dignified manner and how to resolve historical disputes. I am convinced that with your leadership in the successful implementation of reforms aimed at building socialism with Chinese characteristics for a new age, China will soon fulfil the great Chinese dream to the benefit of the whole world.
I am exceptionally proud of the fact that the relations between our two countries have reached the highest level in history, and that now when I have the honour to be the President of Serbia and thus a unique opportunity to invest efforts together with you to further enrich our overall strategic partnership. I look forward to Serbia being part of the visionary 'Belt and Road' initiative, which through its expansion offers the opportunities for further progress to the whole world as evidenced by the increasing number of countries joining it. Serbia attaches great importance to regional cooperation through the cooperation mechanism of China and Central and Eastern European countries.
We are looking forward to the development of economic cooperation, especially project cooperation in the fields of infrastructure and energy, as well as new Chinese investments in Serbia such as the successful investment in Å½elezara Smederevo and RTB Bor, which, with the opening of new factories, contributes to the overall development of Serbia and the region as a whole.
I avail myself of this opportunity to once again iterate my special gratitude to the People's Republic of China in helping us to preserve the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the Republic of Serbia, as a matter of fundamental state and national interest. Given its reputation and influence in the world, we highly appreciate China's understanding, especially in the light of recent attempts by so-called Kosovo aimed at illegal membership in international organizations and institutions. At the same time, I would like to reiterate the unwavering and unequivocal support of Serbia to the "one China" policy", said President VuÄiÄ‡ in his congratulations, adding that he hopes for President Xi's soon visit to Serbia.
Belgrade,
1st October 2019
Share

### 70
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/news/president-vucic-visits-works-on-construction-of-a-part-of-the-belgrade-budapest-high-speed-railway
TITLE: President VuÄiÄ‡ visits works on construction of a part of the Belgrade - Budapest high-speed railway
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

News
30.05.2020. - 12:36
President VuÄiÄ‡ visits works on construction of a part of the Belgrade - Budapest high-speed railway
President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ visited earlier today the construction works on the part of the Belgrade-Budapest high-speed railway from Belgrade to Stara Pazova. The railway is being built according to European standards and will be our state-of-the-art railway.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia /Dimitrije Goll
President VuÄiÄ‡ said he was satisfied with the dynamics of the works and that it would be essential, in addition to another section en route to Budapest - from Novi Sad to Subotica - to build a high-speed railway from Belgrade to NiÅ¡. That section would be designed for speeds of up to 200 kilometres per hour, while the section from NiÅ¡ to PreÅ¡evo - for the speed of 160 kilometres per hour. He stated that the topic is already being discussed with Chinese companies and Russian railways, which are building a part of the high-speed railway from Stara Pazova to Novi Sad.
"We are also considering the Belgrade-NiÅ¡ section, which would mean a lot for passenger traffic from Europe to Serbia, but also our freight." We must not leave out the south of Serbia. Then we would have the entire line of a high-speed railway from Subotica to Novi Sad, Belgrade and NiÅ¡", President VuÄiÄ‡ said and announced that the works on the railway from Belgrade to Stara Pazova will be completed by the end of the year and that the railway will be commissioned by the end of March the following year.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia /Dimitrije Goll
President VuÄiÄ‡ stated that the works on the part of the railway from Stara Pazova to Novi Sad will be completed in August 2021 and that the railway will be opened to traffic in September 2021.
"Then we will hurry up to complete the last section through Serbia, from Novi Sad to Subotica, which could be completed in 2024. The Hungarians will complete their section by the end of 2024 or the beginning of 2025," said President VuÄiÄ‡ and pointed out that from March 2025, we will be able to travel by train from Belgrade to Budapest in two hours and 40 minutes, and then from there to Vienna in another hour and 40 minutes.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia /Dimitrije Goll
"It's important for our relations, and it will increase the living standard of citizens and the flow of goods, which is extremely important for our economy. These are the things that we will remain behind us, revolutionary things that you do not believe in until you see them. Thank you to our Chinese partners for their hard work, efforts and engagement. Thank you to Serbian and Chinese workers for their arduous work", said President VuÄiÄ‡ and emphasised that in Serbia, in addition to the railway, four highways are currently under construction.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia /Dimitrije Goll
The project of a high-speed railway from Belgrade to Budapest has been agreed between Serbia, China and Hungary within the global initiative of the People's Republic of China -
Belt and Road
.
The total value of the construction of the Belgrade-Budapest railway through Serbia is about two billion dollars, and the railway on our side will be about 184 kilometres long.
Stara Pazova,
30th May 2020
Share

### 71
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/news/president-tours-works-on-zemun-station-beska-viaduct
TITLE: President tours works on Zemun-station, BeÅ¡ka viaduct
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

News
25.03.2021. - 16:30
President tours works on Zemun-station, BeÅ¡ka viaduct
President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ toured today the works on the railway station Zemun - section of the high-speed railway Belgrade-Stara Pazova, and the final works on the construction of the viaduct and laying the tracks over the viaduct in BeÅ¡ka, on the section of the high-speed railway Stara Pazova-Novi Sad.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia / Dimitrije Goll
President VuÄiÄ‡ started the control of works on the future railway route for trains with speeds of up to 200 km per hour, on the section Belgrade Centre-Stara Pazova, where he got a promise from Chinese companies engaged on this section of the line that it will be completed by the end of September and that it will be commissioned by the end of the year. It was also announced that works on the last section of the high-speed railway from Novi Sad to the border with Hungary will commence on 1st September this year.
"This is another face of Serbia. Citizens have started riding the rail again. We will have a state-of-the-art railway, the most technologically advanced in this part of Europe. In less than a year, people will be able to ride from Belgrade to Novi Sad," said President VuÄiÄ‡.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia / Dimitrije Goll
The President thanked China and noted that the high-speed railway project from Belgrade to Budapest was agreed upon between Serbia, China and Hungary within the framework of China's global initiative "Belt and Road".
The Ambassador of the People's Republic of China, Chen Bo, also attended the tour of the works on this railway section.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia / Dimitrije Goll
President VuÄiÄ‡ also visited the final works on the construction of the viaduct in BeÅ¡ka and the laying of the tracks on the viaduct within the construction of the high-speed railway from Stara Pazova to Novi Sad.
During the tour of the construction site, the President was interested in when the Russian company that executes the works on that section, will start building the most modern Dispatch Centre for the management of Serbian railways. The director of "RÅ½D International" in Serbia announced that the contract for the first project stage will be concluded in June and that the physical works will start in September, while the entire project of the Dispatch Center, which has several phases, will be completed by the end of 2023.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia / Dimitrije Goll
President VuÄiÄ‡ pointed out that the new Dispatch Centre will be of crucial importance for the development of Serbian railways since it will achieve complete control over railway traffic.
"We will have greater savings and security, we will know which railways and trains are occupied, we will have full control," President VuÄiÄ‡ emphasised.
The Ambassador of the Russian Federation, Botsan-Kharchenko, also attended the tour of the final works on the viaduct construction.
Photo: Presidency of Serbia / Dimitrije Goll
The works on the high-speed railway are currently being executed on the sections from Belgrade to Stara Pazova in the length of 34.5 kilometres where the Chinese companies "CCCC" and "CRI" are engaged and on the route Stara Pazova-Novi Sad in the length of 40.4 kilometres which is being built by the Russian "RÅ½D International".
The total value of the construction of the Belgrade-Budapest railway through Serbia is about two billion dollars, and the railway through Serbia will be about 184 kilometres long.

### 72
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/press-releases/president-vucic-meets-the-vice-president-of-the-chinese-peoples-political-consultative-conference-li-bin
TITLE: President Vucic meets the Vice-President of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference Li Bin
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

Press Releases
30.08.2019. - 14:45
President Vucic meets the Vice-President of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference Li Bin
President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ met earlier today the Vice-President of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference Li Bin, whose visit - as pointed out during the talks - represents yet another confirmation that the "steel friendship" and overall strategic partnership of the two countries are growing stronger in all areas.
The Chinese official conveyed to President VuÄiÄ‡ the greetings of President Xi and said that China particularly appreciates the immense contribution of President VuÄiÄ‡ to the development of bilateral relations and the sincere support to the "Belt and Road" initiative, the cooperation mechanism "17 Plus 1", and the inter-party cooperation. She congratulated President VuÄiÄ‡ for the good economic results Serbia keeps accomplishing.
President VuÄiÄ‡ reciprocated the greetings to President Xi and reiterated on this occasion the firm support to the principles of the "Belt and Road" initiative, and emphasised that it has already brought much happiness to the Serbian people through participation of the Chinese companies in implementation of the most important infrastructure projects as well as through the significant Chinese investments. â€It is one of the greatest and most productive initiatives in history. The respect China confers to all countries and their right to development and independent decision-making irrespective of their size - deserves the support of all who believe in the ideals of true equality and solidarity", said President VuÄiÄ‡.
President VuÄiÄ‡ said that the visit of the Vice-President Li is particularly important considering that theÂ  Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference is the highest advisory body of the State Council of the People's Republic of China and that the suggestions rendered by this body are of vital importance for formulation of the national strategy. The President added he was convinced that the bilateral relations between Serbia and China will continue to develop through intensive political dialogue and diverse economic cooperation.
The two interlocutors have reviewed the possibilities of cooperation in various areas and in particular in the area of tourism considering the ever-increasing number of Chinese tourists in the world. As the number of Chinese tourists in Serbia marks a fivefold growth, they expressed the expectations that a direct flight may be established between Belgrade and Beijing.
The today meeting was also an opportunity to reiterate the mutual support in the issues of crucial interest for the two countries in accordance with the international law. President VuÄiÄ‡ expressed his gratitude for the principled and resolute standpoint of China regarding the respect of territorial integrity and sovereignty of Serbia and affirming again the unwavering support of Serbia to the "One China" policy. With that respect, he said that the current situation in Hong Kong represents the internal issue of China and he remains convinced that President Xi and the thoughtful leadership of China are capable to resolve the issue in a righteous manner.
VIDEO MATERIAL CAN BE DOWNLOADED FROM THE FTP SERVER OF THE MINISTRY OF DEFENCE.
Belgrade,
30th August 2019

### 73
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/news/section-surcin-obrenovac-ceremonially-opened
TITLE: Section SurÄin - Obrenovac ceremonially opened
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

News
18.12.2019. - 17:32
Section SurÄin - Obrenovac ceremonially opened
The President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡ said today that the Belgrade-ÄŒaÄak highway, which was completed today with the opening of the last section SurÄin-Obrenovac, brings a future for Serbia in the economic and in every other sense.
Photo: Presidency / Dimitrije Goll
At the opening of the SurÄin-Obrenovac section, President VuÄiÄ‡ said that all citizens of Serbia should be content with this day because in the coming decades they will be proud of having taken part in the construction of the most important roads for Serbia.
"(The citizens should be proud of taking part) in the endeavours that bring future in the economic and every other aspect, in what will revive Central and Western Serbia, in the efforts that will bring new value and a new quality of life", said President VuÄiÄ‡.
He said that Belgrade and ÄŒaÄak awakened today and decided to start walking towards each other, to become closer, thus making all the places along that road and that part of Serbia members of one big close family.
"Only yesterday, ÄŒaÄak and Belgrade were two and a half hours away, and today - only an hour. Anyone who travels will save one hour of time, and thanks to that will be able to spend more time with family or at work. Today, the Serbian people have become richer in more time, more jobs and more factories," said President VuÄiÄ‡.
Photo: Presidency / Dimitrije Goll
He emphasised that this is the best gift to Serbia after many years of anguish, transition, devastated factories.
I cannot recover to you, the citizens, the time we lost for the roads in the past all due to negligence, indolence, inertness... But today we can make sure that you get more time so that we all mind the future together," said President VuÄiÄ‡.
Visiting the new highway and the magnificent bridge near Obrenovac over the Sava and Kolubara rivers, President VuÄiÄ‡ talked with the representatives of the Chinese company
CCCC
also engaged in the construction of the section from Preljina to PoÅ¾ega, where he was promised by the company Director Zhang Xjaoyun that the road will be completed by the end of 2021.
President VuÄiÄ‡ said that in precisely two years, citizens will be taking the highway from Belgrade to PoÅ¾ega and that they will no longer have troubles in driving through the OvÄar-Kablar Gorge.
Photo: Presidency / Dimitrije Goll
He also said that the development plan will be presented on the 28th December that will not be only the list of nice wishes.
"That will be a plan with a very strong reform agenda appertaining the growth of 6 and more per cent until the year 2025. We seek to take the top position in Europe in the economic growth rate," stressed the President.
Ambassador of China to Serbia, Chen Bo, said today that the opening of the SurÄin-Obrenovac section represents a huge event in the development of Serbia as well as in the cooperation development between China and Serbia. She also wished for the steel friendship of the two countries to progress even further in the coming years.
"We, the Chinese, say that construction of roads is the first step towards wealth," said Chen at the ceremonial opening of the "MiloÅ¡ the Great" highway section.
Photo: Presidency / Dimitrije Goll
She added that she feels pleased when seeing that Serbia has achieved great results in the field of infrastructure in recent years, and especially because the Chinese companies gave their contribution to it.
Ambassador Chen pointed out that the cooperation in the area of infrastructure remains to be an important part of relations between Serbia and China as well as a significant chapter of the "Road and Belt" initiative.
She added that the commissioned sections of the "MiloÅ¡ the Great" highway were constructed by Chinese companies also engaged in other projects such as the construction of the Belgrade bypass, hi-speed railway Belgrade-Budapest and construction of the Preljina-PoÅ¾ega section.
"Nothing is far away anymore," said Ambassador Chen.
Photo: Presidency / Dimitrije Goll
As the SurÄin-Obrenovac section is the first major project in the last few years to be completed before the deadline, Chen thanked for the trust put in the Chinese companies and the Chinese workers who showed the quality and efficiency to Serbia and the whole of Europe.
Ambassador Chen wished everyone a happy family saint day, Saint Nicholas, as well as the New Year, wishing that the steel friendship between Serbia and China will continue to advance in the coming year.
The 17.6 kilometres section of the "MiloÅ¡ the Great" highway that was opened today, completes the Belgrade-ÄŒaÄak highway in the length of 120 kilometres. By the completion of this part of the "MiloÅ¡ the Great" highway, it will be possible to travel from Belgrade to ÄŒaÄak in about one hour.
The new highway has a total of 12 bridge structures, with spans ranging from 11 to 1,581 meters, as well as two large loops - SurÄin and Obrenovac.
Photo: Presidency / Dimitrije Goll

### 75
URL: https://www.predsednik.rs/en/press-center/press-releases/congratulations-from-the-president-of-the-peoples-republic-of-china-on-the-statehood-day-of-the-republic-of-serbia
TITLE: Congratulations from the President of the People's Republic of China on the Statehood Day of the Republic of Serbia
    | The President of the Republic of Serbia

Press Releases
11.02.2021. - 12:34
Congratulations from the President of the People's Republic of China on the Statehood Day of the Republic of Serbia
President of the People's Republic of China Xi Jinping sent congratulations to the President of the Republic of Serbia, Aleksandar VuÄiÄ‡, on the Statehood Day of the Republic of Serbia. The congratulation reads as follows:
"Dear Mr President,
On the occasion of the Statehood Day of the Republic of Serbia, on behalf of the Government and the people of China and my own behalf, I would like to extend my heartfelt congratulations and best wishes to you and the friendly Serbian people.
Sino-Serbian relations maintain a steady development trend. Mutual political trust between the two countries is strong, cooperation in various fields achieves rich results, and steel friendship is continuously deepening. Together, the two sides face the challenges of the COVID-19 virus epidemic, setting an example of cooperation in the fight against the world's epidemic. At my invitation, you recently attended the Summit of the Leaders of China and the countries of Central and Eastern Europe and made an outstanding contribution to the successful holding of the summit, which I highly appreciate.
I attach great importance to the development of relations between China and Serbia. I am ready to raise the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between China and Serbia to an even higher level with you, within the joint development of the Belt and Road initiative, and cooperation between China and the countries of Central and Eastern Europe, to contribute to the well-being of our two countries and nations.
I wish your country a lot of prosperity, and happiness and well-being to your people", reads the congratulation message of President Xi Jinping.
Belgrade,
11th February 2021

### 85
URL: https://www.ifa.gov.et/2026/01/01/ethiopias-diplomatic-transition-during-antonio-guterress-un-tenure-2017-2025-from-security-posture-to-regional-convening
TITLE: Ethiopiaâ€™s Diplomatic Transition during AntÃ³nio Guterresâ€™s UN Tenure (2017â€“2025): From Security Posture to Regional Convening â€“ IFA

Introduction
Since 2018, Ethiopiaâ€™s diplomacy has shifted from an inward, regime-security logic to an outward strategy emphasising regional cooperation, economic interdependence and human security. This transition occurred alongside reforms advanced by UN Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterresâ€”particularly preventive diplomacy, development system reform, and modernisation linked to
Our Common Agenda
(United Nations, 2021). Ethiopia drew on this multilateral moment to reposition itself as a key convener in the Horn of Africa, while also using peacekeeping and climate diplomacy to sustain international standing (Kefale, 2022; United Nations Peacekeeping, 2025).
Major milestones include the 2018 Ethiopiaâ€“Eritrea peace initiative and Ethiopiaâ€™s expanding engagement in Southâ€“South and multipolar groupings, culminating in BRICS accession in 2024 (Fisher and Gebrewold, 2019; BRICS Secretariat, 2024). However, these gains remain vulnerable to renewed regional tensions and domestic political pressure. This brief recommends measures to consolidate Ethiopiaâ€™s regional integration agenda, protect peace dividends, and deepen cooperation with UN reform instrumentsâ€”especially the Resident Coordinator system and anticipatory governance initiatives (United Nations, 2019; UNDESA, 2023).
2. Background and Problem Statement
Before 2018, Ethiopiaâ€™s foreign policy largely followed an â€œoutside-inâ€ model: external engagement was shaped mainly by internal security priorities, ethnic fragmentation concerns, and regime stabilisation needs (Clapham, 2018; Tadesse, 2020). This posture constrained Ethiopiaâ€™s ability to invest consistently in regional institution-building and often narrowed international engagement to counter-insurgency, border deterrence, and security bargaining.
In parallel, multilateral systems faced persistent limitsâ€”fragmented development assistance, storage tower of humanitarian response, and slow conflict-prevention action. Guterresâ€™s agenda sought a more integrated UN presence at country level, linking prevention, development and peace in operational practice (United Nations, 2017; United Nations, 2019). Ethiopiaâ€™s policy challenge became how to convert UN reform priorities into deliverable national and regional outcomes while managing continuing pressures in the Horn of Africa.
3. Analysis and Key Findings
3.1 Regional Integration and the â€œHorn Firstâ€ Shift
During the Prosperity Party period, Ethiopia advanced a â€œHorn Firstâ€ orientation connecting domestic prosperity to the stability of neighbouring statesâ€”closer to regionalist liberalism than classical realism (Medhane, 2019). The 2018 rapprochement with Eritrea ended a prolonged â€œno-war, no-peaceâ€ impasse and signalled willingness to incur political costs to pursue reconciliation (Fisher and Gebrewold, 2019). UN emphasis on preventive diplomacy reinforced this direction (United Nations, 2017). Even amid later strains, Ethiopiaâ€™s preference for restraint and dialogue reflects a move toward de-escalatory diplomatic tools rather than coercive escalation.
3.2 Alignment with UN Institutional Reform
Ethiopia benefited from UN development reform, particularly the strengthened Resident Coordinator system, which improved coherence across agencies and linked UN support more directly to national priorities (United Nations, 2019). System-wide evaluations report strong host-government perceptions of improved coordination following reform, indicating concrete value for states managing intersecting development and humanitarian pressures (UNDESA, 2023). Ethiopiaâ€™s UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (2020â€“2025) aligned UN programming with the Homegrown Economic Reform agenda and the Ten-Year Development Plan, prioritizing inclusion, resilience and sustainability (UN Ethiopia, 2020).
3.3 Peacekeeping as Diplomatic Capital
Ethiopia remained a leading troop contributor and gained influence through UN deployments, including UNISFA and UNMISS (United Nations Peacekeeping, 2025). The Action for Peacekeeping (A4P) initiative raised expectations for performance and accountability, and UN structural adjustments linking political and operational functions strengthened the relationship between field deployments and political strategy (United Nations Peacekeeping, 2018). Ethiopia used peacekeeping as a durable source of credibility even during periods when domestic politics affected its wider soft power.
3.4 Climate Leadership as a Credibility Multiplier
Ethiopiaâ€™s Green Legacy Initiative (2019) positioned the country as a prominent African advocate for nature-based solutions and broadly aligned with Guterresâ€™s emphasis on climate as a central global governance issue (United Nations, 2022). Hosting Africa Climate Summit II in 2025 and advancing the Addis Ababa climate declaration strengthened Ethiopiaâ€™s role as a platform for continental climate diplomacy (AUC, 2025). Climate initiatives also supported domestic goals, including jobs, land restoration, and adaptation planning. Ethiopiaâ€™s Green Legacy Initiative (2019) positioned the country as a prominent African advocate for nature-based solutions and broadly aligned with Guterresâ€™s emphasis on climate as a central global governance issue (United Nations, 2022). Hosting Africa Climate Summit II in 2025 and advancing the Addis Ababa climate declaration strengthened Ethiopiaâ€™s role as a platform for continental climate diplomacy (AUC, 2025). This climate leadership was further reflected in Ethiopiaâ€™s participation at the 2025 G20 Summit in Johannesburg, where it reinforced Africaâ€™s collective climate priorities within global economic and governance forums. Climate initiatives also supported domestic goals, including jobs, land restoration, and adaptation planning.
4. Conclusion and recommendations
Ethiopiaâ€™s external strategy in the Horn of Africa is most credible when it links regional stability to tangible economic gains, stronger multilateral delivery, and measurable resilience outcomes. A practical way to close the gap between ambition and results is to consolidate â€œHorn Firstâ€ through institutionalized interdependence. By scaling cross-border infrastructure, energy connectivity, and trade corridors with Sudan, Djibouti, Kenya, and other neighbors, Ethiopia can help build a predictable â€œcommunity of gainsâ€ in which shared revenues, logistics efficiencies, and power pooling raise the cost of conflict and lower incentives for disruption. In this framing, diplomacy becomes a tool for de-risking investment and normalizing cooperation through projects that make everyday welfare depend on stable relations.
At the same time, Ethiopia can convert multilateral engagement into stronger domestic delivery by using UN reform instruments as coordination levers. The Resident Coordinator system and the UN Cooperation Framework offer channels to align development partners around national priorities, reduce duplication, and strengthen planning for drought and food security via anticipatory action, data, and forecasting tools (United Nations, 2019; UNDESA, 2023). If Ethiopia pairs this coordination role with clear targetsâ€”such as early response triggers, pre-positioned supplies, and resilience investments in hotspot areasâ€”UN processes can become visible to citizens as well as donors, strengthening legitimacy and results.
Ethiopiaâ€™s long-standing peacekeeping role remains an important asset, but it gains more strategic value when paired with expanded prevention diplomacy. Maintaining troop contributions can continue to signal responsibility and provide leverage in multilateral forums; however, a parallel investment in political mediation capacity, early-warning cooperation, and stabilization diplomacy would show that Ethiopia is contributing to conflict prevention, not only crisis response. The aim is to connect security commitments to prevention outcomes that can be tracked: fewer border incidents, stronger dispute-resolution channels, and faster diplomatic de-escalation when shocks occur.
Finally, Ethiopia can strengthen its international standing by converting climate diplomacy into finance and resilience delivery. The Green Legacy Initiative and climate summit outcomes can be connected to bankable pipelines for adaptation and green growthâ€”especially land restoration, biodiversity protection, water security, and resilient infrastructure. By improving project preparation, strengthening monitoring, and positioning programs for climate funds and blended finance, Ethiopia can shift from narrative leadership to resource mobilization that households and regions can experience through reduced climate vulnerability and more stable livelihoods.
Taken together, these four options form a coherent agenda: Ethiopia can anchor â€œHorn Firstâ€ in interdependence, improve development results through UN coordination tools, couple peacekeeping with visible prevention diplomacy, and translate climate leadership into financed resilience (United Nations, 2019; UNDESA, 2023). This integrated approach also aligns with Ethiopiaâ€™s wider diplomatic posture as reflected in its policy architecture at the 2025 G20 Summitâ€”signaling a move from primarily inward development planning to more proactive global engagement. Grounded in technological modernization and a commitment to green growth, Ethiopiaâ€™s diplomacy presents a template for how African economies can pursue influence in global governance while protecting national priorities. By advancing Just Energy Transition, Digital Sovereignty and global institutional reform, Ethiopia positions itself as an active contributor to the rebalancing of economic power and agenda-setting, rather than a peripheral participant.

TITLE: State Minister of Finance Meets Dutch Minister for Foreign Trade and Development, to Advance 100-Year Partnership

State Minister of Finance Meets Dutch Minister for Foreign Trade and Development, to Advance 100-Year Partnership
Published:
Dec. 19, 2025
Addis Ababa, December 19, 2025 â€“
H.E. Semereta Sewasew, State Minister of Finance of Ethiopia, today met with a high-level Dutch delegation at the Grand Palace to discuss strengthening economic relations, supporting debt reforms, and expanding Dutch investment in Ethiopia. The delegation was led by H.E. Aukje de Vries, Minister for Foreign Trade and Development of the Netherlands, and H.E. Christine Pirenne, Netherlands Ambassador to Ethiopia.
The meeting comes as Ethiopia and the Netherlands approach a historic milestone: 100 years of diplomatic and economic relations. State Minister Semereta highlighted the Netherlands as a key trading partner, noting that over 100 Dutch entrepreneurs are currently active in Ethiopia, particularly in the agriculture and horticulture sectors.
Minister de Vries expressed strong interest in Ethiopiaâ€™s ongoing economic reform programs, including its engagement with the IMF and debt restructuring initiatives. H.E. Semereta emphasized the governmentâ€™s priority to "create enough space for private sector engagement" while enhancing trade relations to increase domestic revenue and boost exports.
Discussions also focused on improving the business and investment climate. While recognizing Dutch investorsâ€™ commitment to long-term strategic partnerships, both sides acknowledged existing challenges and expressed optimism that the business environment would continue to improve.
The meeting concluded with plans for upcoming initiatives to further strengthen collaboration. A Dutch trade mission focused on horticulture and logistics is scheduled for March, followed by an EU business conference in April. These initiatives aim to leverage the shared "hands-on mentality" of both nations to drive sustainable economic growth.
The high-level delegation from the Dutch Government and the Minister of Finance made a remarkable visit of the Jubilee Palace witnessing a living relic, reflecting Ethiopiaâ€™s royal heritage and an iconic featureÂ of the countryâ€™s history.

Ms. Patricia LLOMBART CUSSAC, Managing Director for Africa in the European External Action Service (EEAS). The meeting focused on a wide range of bilateral, regional, and international issues of mutual interest.
During the discussion State Minister Semereta explained elements of the ongoing Home Grown Economic Reform and underlined the need to encourage European Investors to take advantage of the macro-economic reforms and various opportunities to do business in Ethiopia. Further more she reaffirmed Ethiopiaâ€™s commitment to create strong partnership with the EU and its Member States in economic development, peace and security, and migration. She also highlighted issues causing problem for smooth conduct of businesses and seamless political discourse.
State Minister addressed critical regional developments including the peace and security of the Horn, reaffirming Ethiopiaâ€™s commitment to peaceful coexistence and economic integration in the sub-region. She underlined the countryâ€™s proactive efforts towards interdependence and cooperation for mutual benefit.
The Managing Director on her part commend Ethiopiaâ€™s role in ensuring peace and stability at regional level and acknowledged the stance on peaceful co-existence. She reiterated the EUâ€™s support for regional stability and development. She also appreciated the macro-economic reform.
The two officials have agreed to strengthen the historic relation that exists between the EU and Ethiopia and reaffirmed their commitment to cooperate on bilateral, regional and global issues of mutual interests.

### 90
URL: https://www.mofed.gov.et/blog/he-semereta-sewasew-attends-the-120th-oacps-council-of-ministers-in-brussels
TITLE: H.E. Semereta Sewasew Attends the 120th OACPS Council of Ministers in Brussels

H.E. Semereta Sewasew Attends the 120th OACPS Council of Ministers in Brussels
Published:
Dec. 13, 2025
H.E. Semereta Sewasew, State Minister of Finance of Ethiopia, is participating in the 120th Session of the Council of Ministers of the Organisation of African, Caribbean and Pacific States (OACPS), currently underway in Brussels, Belgium.
In her address to the Council, H.E. the State Minister highlighted the organisationâ€™s significant achievements since its establishment in 1975, particularly its role in fostering Southâ€“South solidarity and strengthening international cooperation. She emphasized that Ethiopia attaches great importance to collective approaches in addressing shared global challenges and reaffirmed the countryâ€™s continued commitment to supporting and strengthening the OACPS.
H.E. Semereta also highlighted the priority areas of intervention for the organisation, which include institutional reform, financial sustainability, trade and investment promotion, sustainable development, and peace and stability, aimed at enhancing the OACPSâ€™s effectiveness and delivering tangible benefits to its 75 member countries.
The 120th Session of the OACPS Council of Ministers is deliberating on key agenda items, including institutional reform initiatives to make the organisation fit for purpose, measures to ensure its financial sustainability, preparations for the 11th OACPS Summit scheduled for March 2026, as well as other administrative matters.
The OACPS is an international organisation established under the Georgetown Agreement in 1975 and comprises 75 member countries from Africa, the Caribbean, and the Pacific. It serves as a platform for policy coordination and collective engagement on the global stage, particularly in partnership with the European Union.

TITLE: State Minister Semereta Sewasew Engages INTPA and ECHO Leadership to Strengthen Ethiopiaâ€“EU Cooperation

State Minister Semereta Sewasew Engages INTPA and ECHO Leadership to Strengthen Ethiopiaâ€“EU Cooperation
Published:
Dec. 12, 2025
H.E. Semereta Sewasew, State Minister of Finance of Ethiopia, held discussions with Mr. Koen Doens, Director-General for International Partnerships (INTPA) of the European Commission, on the sidelines of the 120th Session of the OACPS Council of Ministers on 12 December 2025.
The meeting focused on revitalizing the Ethiopiaâ€“EU partnership, with emphasis on investment, migration, and peace and security.
H.E. the State Minister highlighted the strong record of cooperation between Ethiopia and the EU and emphasized the Governmentâ€™s expectation that the European Commission resume budget support, following the lead of several EU Member States. She reaffirmed Ethiopiaâ€™s readiness to work closely with the Commission to fulfill the necessary requirements.
She also underscored the importance of scaling up investment flows under the Global Gateway Initiative, particularly promoting private sector engagement in key areas such as energy, agro-processing and agricultural value chains, and infrastructure development, noting Ethiopiaâ€™s continued efforts to improve the business environment and investment climate.
Mr. Koen Doens emphasized Ethiopiaâ€™s substantial potential for investment and its central role in regional peace and security. He reaffirmed the EUâ€™s commitment to deepening cooperation based on an equal and mutually beneficial partnership and expressed readiness to strengthen collaboration.
Both sides exchanged views on regional peace and economic development and reiterated their commitment to continued engagement.
In a separate meeting, H.E. Semereta Sewasew met with Ms. Andrea Koulaimah, Director for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (ECHO).
Discussions addressed the effects of declining support to humanitarian and social protection programs, the effectiveness of decentralized humanitarian operations, modalities for delivering assistance, the humanitarianâ€“development nexus, and the importance of preventing overlaps between humanitarian and social protection interventions. The two sides also discussed challenges related to the administration of tax waivers for humanitarian activities.
H.E. the State Minister expressed appreciation for the EUâ€™s continued support to humanitarian operations. The meeting concluded on a positive note, with both sides reaffirming their commitment to strengthen cooperation and jointly address existing challenges.

TITLE: Germany Commits EUR 206 Million to Deepen Partnership with Ethiopia; Focus on Economic Reforms, Regional Stability, and Support for IDPs

Germany Commits EUR 206 Million to Deepen Partnership with Ethiopia; Focus on Economic Reforms, Regional Stability, and Support for IDPs
Published:
Dec. 10, 2025
Addis Ababa, Ethiopia â€“ December 10, 2025 â€” High-level delegations from the Federal Republic of Germany and the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia met today in Addis Ababa to reaffirm and further strengthen their longstanding bilateral cooperation.
The German delegation was led by H.E. Reem Alabali-Radovan, Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ), while the Ethiopian side was led by H.E. Ahmed Shide, Minister of Finance. Minister Radovanâ€™s mandate centers on reform-oriented cooperation and advancing sustainable, inclusive development partnerships.
The meeting followed the signing of the Ethioâ€“German Three-Year Cooperation Framework Agreement (2025â€“2027). Ethiopia welcomed the strong political will demonstrated by Germanyâ€™s new government to continue engagement, even amidst domestic political pressures surrounding development assistance.
Germany Announces EUR 206 Million in New Commitments
Under the new cooperation framework, Germany pledged a total of EUR 206 million, comprising:
â€¢ EUR 106 million for project- and program-based Technical and Financial Cooperation; and
â€¢ EUR 100 million in direct budget support aligned with Ethiopiaâ€™s reform agenda.
The EUR 106 million will support Germanyâ€™s priority areas of cooperation in Ethiopia, including:
â€¢ Building peaceful and inclusive societies,
â€¢ Supporting the transformation of agriculture, and
â€¢ Promoting sustainable economic development.
Ethiopia Highlights Reform Momentum
Minister Ahmed Shide provided an update on Ethiopiaâ€™s ongoing macroeconomic and structural reforms, emphasizing the governmentâ€™s commitment to deepening reform implementation. Priority areas highlighted include:
â€¢ Improving the functioning of the exchange market,
â€¢ Enhancing logistics and trade facilitation, and
â€¢ Strengthening government service delivery.
He also underscored the urgent investment needs of the energy sectorâ€”from generation to transmission and distributionâ€”and the importance of private-sector participation to close the financing gap. Ethiopia is working to attract more foreign direct investment (FDI) and improve the overall business climate.
Climate Action and Global Leadership
Minister Radovan reaffirmed Germanyâ€™s strong leadership on climate action, emphasizing its continued commitment to green transformation. She highlighted Germanyâ€™s significant contributions to major global climate-finance instruments, including:
â€¢ The Loss and Damage Fund, and
â€¢ The Tropical Forests and Biodiversity (TFF) Facility, in which Germany is a major contributor.
Regional Stability and Security
Discussions also covered the evolving regional security landscape. Minister Ahmed Shide expressed concern over the situation in Sudan, stressing that a sustainable solution must be driven by a Sudanese-owned process supported by a well-coordinated international effort.
Ethiopia reaffirmed its commitment to serve as a neutral and constructive partner in efforts to restore peace in the region.
Minister Ahmed also reiterated Ethiopiaâ€™s pursuit of peacefu and legal access to the sea, emphasizing that this objective is essential for Ethiopiaâ€™s long-term security and economic future. He stressed that the government remains committed to a diplomatic solution
Growing German Private-Sector Interest
The meeting referenced the strong interest shown by German companies during the recent Ethioâ€“German Business Forum, with particular focus on:
â€¢ Major infrastructure investments, including the planned new international airport,
â€¢ Opportunities in digitalization,
â€¢ High-tech industries, and
â€¢ Artificial intelligence (AI).
Looking Ahead
Both delegations concluded the meeting by reaffirming their commitment to deepening the longstanding diplomatic relationship and strengthening development cooperation between the two countries.
